intro: Austropeucedanum, commonly known as the New Zealand cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest floors and stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and is often found in the understorey of native forests. Austropeucedanum is valued for its ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
